website_summaries.verdict: Whether you're looking to turn your PC into a DVR or simply want to watch TV on your desktop, the Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-150 does the job at a reasonable price.

customer_reviews.title: Great PVR
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. I have Windows Media Center and it works flawlessly with it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is twofold. One, for some reason no one (including tech support)can figure out why the remote that came with it will not open Media Center, but will do fine once I open MC normally. I was able to use their win2000 software from their website but the second issue is: There is no video editing capability for that software. Even a small application would have been appreciated. I will have to get Adobe.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: mine came in iffy packaging (cut up Cheerios box and ...
customer_reviews.text: mine came in iffy packaging (cut up Cheerios box and Styrofoam chunks) but works with my system. as for using it to connect to composite and s video cables and record media into my pc, i havnt found a program that works well yet. it interfaces OK with windows movie maker (not live, i have a XP machine) but i get a lot of system lag and no audio recording. your suppose to buy winTV 6 or 7 in order to use it but thats an additional 25$ that i wasnt informed about. hopefully i can find a our a program that will interface propertly
customer_reviews.author: Clay W. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I tried several similar products (including ATI which didn't work at all) and none really worked very well but the Hauppauge Win-TV-PVR-150 was easy to install and use with the software that came with it. It works very well and I have no software or hardware conflicts. I didn't care for the Ulead softeware for creating the DVD's but it did the job. I bought the Sony Movie Studio+DVD software which is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Woody Woodturner

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my HP Desktop PC!
customer_reviews.text: The card slid right into my HP Pavilion a1523w-b Desktop PC. The setup was flawless. I am using an HP Media Center Remote Control for Microsoft Windows Media Center Edition 2005. The picture quality is satisfactory. I can watch TV and surf the internet without any glitches. It is the best accessory (hardware) I have added to my PC, to date!
customer_reviews.author: George Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works great with MythTV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card as a replacement for my Happauge 350 card being used in my MythTV system. This card dropped right in without any additional configuration. It's been continuously running for a few months now without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Works well with MythTV
customer_reviews.text: This card is well supported in Linux and is not difficult to use in MythTV. The remote control works in Linux too. I can't find much information how to make the IR blaster control a cable box in Linux. I think is not well supported. The information that I found on how to make it work in Linux is not very clear. I decided to buy a serial port IR blaster for $15. It seems it will be easier to set it up to control the cable box.
customer_reviews.author: amazon reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product! I installed the card in my Dell Dimension 4600 without a single problem. The software also installed without a single glitch (how refreshing!), and now I am watching TV on my computer! The remote control, too, is a gem. The software includes a channel guide, DVD/VCD editing tools and a scheduler so you can record your favorite shows.
customer_reviews.author: Chad (Alexandria, VA)

customer_reviews.title: Audio Lags Video
customer_reviews.text: The card arrived as expected and the packaging was protective of the card. I find that the audio lags the video when using the card. Otherwise, it meets ecpectations.
customer_reviews.author: Hard to please....

customer_reviews.title: why 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tv card all around the tv quality is very very good the only thing that I don't like is that it won't record direct to dvd from the external imput you have to save it to a file than copy to the dvd this will not act as a video capture card if you want to put your home vhs or cam corder on a dvd. You have to save it in mpeg format first.
customer_reviews.author: Edward V.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product (I want another!)
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely awesome. The included software is a bit lacking, I suggest upgrading to beyond tv or sage tv. The hardware makes up for it with great graphic reception, and a really good mpeg compression scheme. I would HIGHLY recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in timely manner, worked perfectly for what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in timely manner, worked perfectly for what I needed it for, MythTV backend. Needed it to receive cable channels in basic tier. Would buy from seller again.
customer_reviews.author: clarence garrett

customer_reviews.title: PVR hardware for use with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Very good card for using with Linux & KnoppMyth. Unlike the AVerMedia cards, it was detected right away, and worked without having to re-do things. Playback quality is very good, but I would suggest a SATA-II drive if you are going to watch a recording whilst recording another.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to record and watch TV on your computer
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this product to watch TV and record programs. Works well with Windows Media and WinTV2000. WinTV2000 is a little clunky but records MPEG2 video. With Windows Media it has to be converted to MPEG2, which adds time to making DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: John Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Works great with MythTV (on Mythdora)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, and easy to use and install. I have used mine on the MythDora release of Linux, as a home-built PVR computer using spare parts. I can't believe it was this easy to get it to work!
customer_reviews.author: A. Purohit

customer_reviews.title: WinTV-PVR-150
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Installed easily Good software bundle Cons: Audio quality sometimes poor Remote control sometimes finicky

customer_reviews.title: The only reason im giving such a bad ratting is because the seller failed to even specify ...
customer_reviews.text: connection type is not PCI Express 3.0. Could not use at all. The only reason im giving such a bad ratting is because the seller failed to even specify what connection type was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Janetplanet

customer_reviews.title: Great card!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. All channels are clear, sound is great. Check out GB-PVR, its a free pvr software. The interface is easy to use, seting up recordings is simple and intuitive. If you get a bad picture, you might have a dud card. RMA it, for a new card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality if much better than my old tuner card. It was very easy to set up with myth tv in Linux. Except for all the remote control buttons aren't set up probably right out of the box in mythtv.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Keith Miller

customer_reviews.title: you need to handy with a soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: it came with one capacitor hanging on. it fell off when i inserted the board.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well under Linux. I used it to back up old VHS-tapes to disk. I have not tested the tuner part, as there are no analog TV signals in my area any more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: OEM Hauppauge PCI card.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement part from my 7 year old HP Media Center PC. I only use the video and audio inputs on this card and it works great! It does not have the white label as shown but otherwise it is just like the OEM PCI card.

customer_reviews.title: Good product ...

Finally I download the last drivers from manufacturers web site and got fixed the problem. It supposed that the Software CD contents the correct drivers for Win Xp but its not true. That is the only issue I found.

customer_reviews.title: good product

customer_reviews.title: Be very Careful
customer_reviews.text: Hauppauge packaged their HVR 1600 in the WinTv 150 PVR box that I bought from Amazon. The HVR is a newer product that I could not get to work, especially the VHS taping part. The point is I did not order the HVR 1600, but it was sent in the correct box. THis has put a damper on my buying from Hauppauge and Amazon. I sent it back. We'll see if Amazon gives me a refund. JR

customer_reviews.title: Useless scrap
customer_reviews.text: This is obsolete. Do not buy! All broadcast ATSC/NTSC are digital. This is analog and obsolete. No one broadcast in analog anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoniac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great! (purchased through Amazon)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a used Media Center TV tuner pc card for my computer to replace the one that died. It was easy to purchase, easy to install, and it works great! The board looks different than the original but I made sure they had identical connectors.
customer_reviews.author: DHF

customer_reviews.title: Just works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the non-HD card to get if you're gonna get one. It just works, whether XP or older, or Linux, this is great. I've popped these in an uncountable number of systems and I keep a stock for future use. I even plugged up a n64 recently through the composite, and fired up some old skool goodness for a few minutes. For PVR, they're not so great, but not really a concern for me. The offering listed here currently is a bit much, so shop around. They're a dime a dozen and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Maros

customer_reviews.title: Good TV Tuner and mpeg encoder
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several different tuner cards and found this one to work the best. I've owned a MTI card and Pinnacle MovieBox and neither did the job of archiving my home movies very well. I have several that I archived with the older hardware and now plan to redo them with this new card. Fortunately I believe this will be the last time I will need to archive them due to the quality of this card. Having the mpeg encoder built into the card is also a major plus since I can get other work done while the video's are being archived. If you've been disappointed by older technology, like me, I recommend the card.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rossow

customer_reviews.title: very good card
customer_reviews.text: Have had this card for about a year now and outside of a known issue of the recording audio being loud (I can live with it)it has been a dynamite tv card for me. I have a shuttle MB (Athlon 2.6Ghz)1Gb mem, 120GB HD. I select the TV shows via TitanTV (included - card works directly with it), it records it to the HD, then I watch it on my TV via my GoVideo network DVD player. If I don't want the commercials in the recording I edit them out with VideoRedo Plus. Works very sweet indeed....
customer_reviews.author: VideoHound

customer_reviews.title: Hardware works fine, but software is cryptic
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to capture video from VHS tapes. The hardware works fine, and has no trouble locking to even a glitchy signal. I'm using generic hardware and Windows XP, and have not had any dropped frames. The MPEG-2 encoding, which allows a variety of bit rates, seems solid as well. On the other hand, the WinTV 6.0 software for capturing video is totally confusing. It took hours of experimentation before I understood it. Does anybody know of other capture software that's compatible with this board?
customer_reviews.author: L. Wixson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my ATI all in wonder card had issues when I first installed MCE onto my media PC. The first thing I noticed was the software was easy to use and easy to set up. SO why do I say 3 stars? The remote is awful. It is easily the worst remote I have ever tried to use and it doesn't work half the time. I downloaded the newest drivers for ATI and the All-in-Wonder is working well now. So now the WinTV is used for duel tuner setup now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Geisler

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product ... transforms monitor into professional TV!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It installed easily. It works great. I LOVE how my flat panel computer monitor can work as a professional TV + TiVO machine ... all in one. I especially liked the preview up to 16 channels functionality. If only everything worked as well as this ....
customer_reviews.author: TashNYC

customer_reviews.title: Cannot receive digital over-the-air signals
customer_reviews.text: Just a word of caution. This is an analog device. It was probably pretty decent back in the day. I didn't try hooking up a VCR or other device to it. However, if you were hoping to attach an antenna and be able to use it to capture video from over-the-air broadcasts, think again. You cannot. If you want to hook up your existing cable TV to it and record to your PC's hard drive, it will probably do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kendahl

customer_reviews.title: If they would send you the right card
customer_reviews.text: I am not the first person to have this problem. What I received was in fact a WinTv-HVR-1600. Which is not at all the same as a WinTV-PVR-150 because it does not have Linux drivers. Then I had to go to the trouble of calling Haupauge to get them to switch it out. Had to pay shipping to send them the 150. More than a week went by before I was able to build my MythTV Box.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This tuner card is a great addition to any computer. The card was easy to install and works pefectly. I had to improve the fine tuning on a few channels. I read several reviews. Many complained about the included software. I almost did not install the software,but I decided to give it a try and see if I could save some money. Well most of the reviews about the software were wrong. It works perfectly and I have no complaints. Yes some of the commercial software packages look better and do offer more features, but I am satisfied with the software that came with the card. Both the hardware and software function as it should if not better.
customer_reviews.author: roy degler

customer_reviews.title: good product questionable software
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the hardware, it works fine. The software, although it works, is not very good. They have winTV2000, and I think it was written in 2000. Picture is good. I haven't tried it in Linux, but I've read Linux has better software for this card.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Unbeliveable card
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. Don't mess with any other brand (I tried a cheaper card (ATI) from a local store and I was sorry I did). Popped this in my system, loaded the software/drivers and I was off and running. I took this one step further and used a video card with a TV out to connect to my television and now I have TV, TV Guide, Net Radio, Video Record, DVD, downloaded moves and music all in one place. The remote is flawless. This is an absolutely top notch card. Try this card with GBPVR (which is freeware) and you will be in multimeda heaven!
customer_reviews.author: Yooper49945

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very nice tuner works well has nice options and accesorys the only complaint i have is that i wish the display image could go a little bit bigger than its 720x480 considering i have a widscreen monitor running 1440x900 so i cant really take advantage of that but oh well i dont miss any of my shows!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase

The hardware encoding is excellent, and saves my Pentium III 500 a lot of work. The only complaint I have is that the included remote is not programmable, and is thus useless, unless I wish to have another remote lying around.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Korman

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.

If you have the 42 button silver remote press the second button from the left at the very bottom of the remote (4 buttons of different colors). In my case this starts/stops full screen. I use Snapstream BeyondTV but this may work with the WinTV app that comes with the product.

This shipped really fast and couldnt ask for much better!

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does what it says.

customer_reviews.title: 5 years of service and running

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Use it with Linux DVR MythTV.

customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Slow sometimes

I attribute this to my PC but something to keep in mind. My PC has 1GB of ram and a three year old processor. If your system is better, I imagine there will be no problem. The remote is sufficient and IR sensor works fine from 10 feet and has little angle dependence.
customer_reviews.author: Big Chef

customer_reviews.title: WinTV-PVR-150
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 7/15/06. It took about 15 minutes to install and get working. Everything installed flawlessly and the product works exactly as advertised. Very pleased with the card. Sound and video is clear. I am using this on a pc in a room with no TV and this fits my needs perfectly. I have tried most of the functions from recording, pausing, using the remote (which works great!). So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Posey

customer_reviews.title: WinTV-PVR-150
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and up in running with no problems. Picture is good for a TV card and performance is up to speed. Pause feature allows me to cut away from the game or show anytime. I can run thru a football game in 1/2 the time it takes. Saves valuable space on my desktop since I did have a regular small TV before. Does make some programs slow down a little but my system is average at best so on a top system should be less of an issue. Remote is useful and cable box feature is a big plus if you have to use it.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mythtv Card

Even though the picture quality is good for a capture card, I am still waiting for a/any capture card to match DVR picture quality.

product_meta.title: Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-150 PCI TV Tuner
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Ever been called to the phone, had to answer the door, or went for a snack and missed part of the big match? With WinTV-PVR, you'll never miss the action again. Just click on WinTV-PVR's "One Touch Pause" button to pause your TV program, click again to continue watching where you left off. Then fast forward to catch up to the live broadcast. WinTV-PVR-150 puts TV watching under your control! Watch TV on your PC screen (in a window or full screen), digitally record your TV shows, or pause live TV and create your own instant replay.

 Record your TV programs or home videos onto DVD or CD, and play them on your DVD player! If you have a DVD burner in your PC, use the WinTV-PVR’s MPEG files with the included Ulead DVD MovieFactory to author your own home DVD’s. Turn your TV shows or home videos into DVD movies!PEG-2 video is sent over the PCI bus, where it is stored on the PCs hard disk. The video can also be played back to the PC screen while recording.

 WinTV-PVR-150 contains a high quality 10-bit video digitizer with 4 line adaptive comb filter to reduce video noise, plus a highly integrated MPEG-1/2 hardware encoder. WinTV-PVR-150 can record full screen TV or video at data rates from 2.5 to 12 Mbits/sec from TV, VCR or camcorder. The encoded MPEG-2 video is sent over the PCI bus, where it is stored on the PCs hard disk. The video can also be played back to the PC screen while recording.

 Create your own Digital Video Recorder! The WinTV-PVR-150 turns your PC into a digital video recorder. Record TV program or home videos to disk, play them back to your PC screen or burn them onto DVD. With data rates from 4.4MBits/sec up to 12Mbits/sec (or as low as 1 Mbit/sec with VCD formats), you decide how much hard disk space your videos will consume. At DVD quality, a typical one hour TV show will take 2 gigabytes of hard disk space. Control your cable TV or satellite set top box with WinTV-PVR-150’s IR Blaster. Both WinTV2000 and the WinTV-Scheduler can automatically control the channel on your set top box, so you no longer need to manually change set top box channels.The IR Blaster cable is one meter in length. Position the infrared transmitter over your set top box's infrared receiver, and the WinTV-PVR-150 can send channel change commands to the set top box via the infrared transmitter. The IR Blaster has 300 different set top boxes it can control.

 WinTV-PVR's pause feature gives you control of what you watch in your WinTV window. Get personal "instant replay" to stop the action when you want to analyze a key scene. Instantly rewind and replay the action again. You're in control with WinTV-PVR! WinTV-PVR-150 puts TV watching under your control! Watch TV on your PC screen (in a window or full screen), digitally record your TV shows, or pause live TV and create your own instant replay.

 Features and Benefits

 

 * Schedule your TV recordings on a daily, weekly or once only schedule With link to TitanTV.com, the on-line electronic program guide 
 * Record your TV shows to disk using the built-in hardware MPEG-2 encoder. Uses from 1-2 Gigabytes per hour of recorded video. While recording, the WinTV-PVRs' hardware MPEG encoder does all the work so your PC continues to run at full speed 
 * Turn your TV shows and home videos into DVD or CD. Includes Ulead DVD MovieFactory for disk burning 
 * Now with IR Blaster, to control set top boxes 
 * You can cut and trim your videos without losing video quality using WinTV-Editor
feature_bullets: Watch TV on your PC screen using a 125 channel cable ready TV tuner.
Record your TV shows to disk using the built-in hardware MPEG-2 encoder.
Pause your live TV shows with instant replay, fast forward and rewind.
Composite/S-Video and audio inputs, to connect to VCR or camcorders.
dbx-TV stereo decoder, for great TV sound. (Nicam stereo on PAL models)
